definition: to pledge undying love (idiom); oath of eternal love/to swear by all the Gods
surname Shan
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
oath/pledge/union/to ally/league, a subdivision corresponding to prefecture in Inner Mongolia
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
surname Hai
oath/vow/to swear/to pledge

sentences.english: Any oath Can NOT be totally trusted.
sentences.chinese: 一切山盟海誓都不能完全相信。

sentences.english: Rather than give me a pledge of eternal love, to accompany me through each spring, summer, autumn and winter.
sentences.chinese: 与其给我山盟海誓，不如陪我走过每一个春夏秋冬。

sentences.english: "We have got a play" said he "it is to be lovers'vows;
sentences.chinese: “我们要演一个剧，”他说，“是《山盟海誓》。

sentences.english: Tom and Mary exchanged their vows before the altar.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆和玛丽在圣坛前，山盟海誓永结良缘。

sentences.english: All the solemn pledges of love.
And obtained numerous pledge of lovers.
sentences.chinese: 赢得了多少情侣的山盟海誓。
